title: How to write a 'thank you' mail to my boss - Quora

response.answer_text: How would you write a thank you letter to your motherinlaw or even the leader of your country. It is all the same. Think politely, include the words thank you for (this item or concept) and end it there. A thank you letter is just that, thanks. Never include anything that can be taken out of context or used against you in a verbal argument or a court of law. If you are sending the thank you letter because of requirement and obligation and not because you are truly thankful…..then always think of it as the polite insult of politician speak.

Consider what your boss does around the entire work unit. Consider how your boss improves the work environment. Consider how they make you feel as an employee (thoughts like I feel valued). Consider how the boss improves the morale of the work unit. Now, take all of those considerations and turn them into a constructive letter that demonstrates how the work unit is made better by this person.

John, Thanks so much for the recognition and compliments you bestowed on me during the team meeting. I was surprised and pleased. This reflects directly on you and what a great manager you are. I hope you know how much you’re appreciated. Thanks again, Xena
